Gunung Semeru 'Bertopi', Netizen Tanya Kapan Jalur Dibuka Lagi
07 Nov 2019, 12:11 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Awan Lenticular di Gunung Semeru (Foto: Taman Nasional Bromo Tengger Semeru/Instagram)

Jakarta - Gunung Semeru pamer pemandangan sedang "bertopi". Cantik! Netizen yang sudah tak sabar ke sana pun bertanya kapan jalur pendakiannya akan kembali dibuka.Dilihat dari akun Instagram resmi Taman Nasional Bromo Tengger Semeru (TNBTS), Kamis (7/11/2019), terlihat awan lenticular menyelimuti puncak Gunung Semeru. Pemandangan ini sendiri sejatinya relatif sering terjadi."Selamat pagi Sahabat Mentari Tengger... pagi ini puncak semeru nampak gagah ber "topi caping" lho... fenomena awan caping atau disebut juga awan Lenticular di puncak gunung adalah suatu fenomena yang umum terjadi ya sahabat...," kata akun itu.TNBTS juga menjelaskan, terbentuknya awan tersebut akibat pergerakan angin yang menabrak pegunungan atau bukit. Momen dijadikannya menarik simpati pendaki sekaligus mengabarkan bahwa Gunung Semeru masih ditutup."Menurut literatur, awan tersebut terbentuk dari hasil pergerakan angin yang menabrak dinding penghalang besar seperti pegunungan atau perbukitan sehingga menimbulkan pusaran di puncak seperti topi caping... Gimana, sudah bikin kangen semeru kan sahabat?" tanyanya."Sabar dulu ya..Biarkan alam melakukan pemulihannya dulu setelah terluka. Semoga doa dan sabarnya para sahabat bisa jadi obat untuk kesembuhannya. Salam Konservasi," pungkas TNBTS dalam unggahannya.

[Gambas:Instagram]

Di kolom komentar postingan itu memang banyak sudah yang merindukan ingin mendaki Gunung Semeru lagi. Mount Semeru 'Has a Hat', Netizens Ask When The Track Is Opened Again
Nov 7 2019, 12:11 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Lenticular clouds on Mount Semeru (Photo: Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park / Instagram)

Jakarta - Mount Semeru shows off its "hats" view. Beautiful! Netizens who can't wait to go there also ask when the hiking trail will be reopened. Seen from the official Instagram account of Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park (TNBTS), Thursday (11/07/2019), visible lenticular clouds surround the summit of Mount Semeru. This sight itself is actually relatively common. "Good morning, Friends of the Tengari Mentari ... this morning the peak of Semeru looks dashing" caping ", you know ... the phenomenon of caping clouds or also called Lenticular clouds at the top of the mountain is a common phenomenon that occurs friends ..., "said the account. NTBTS also explained, the formation of these clouds due to wind movements that hit mountains or hills. The moment he made attracting the sympathy of climbers as well as preaching that Mount Semeru is still closed. "According to the literature, the cloud is formed from the results of wind movements that hit a large barrier wall such as mountains or hills causing a vortex at the top like a caping hat ... How, already made me miss semeru aren't you friends? " "Be patient first ... Let nature do its recovery first after being injured. Hopefully the prayers and patience of the friends can be a cure for healing. Greetings Conservation," concluded TNBTS in its upload.

[Gambas: Instagram]

In the comments column of that post, many have missed wanting to climb Mount Semeru again. Given the beautiful view of Mount Semeru "with a hat" they were increasingly enthusiastic about asking for certainty when the track was opened.
